snippets: Elderly patients taking NSAIDs have higher risk of gastrointestinal ulceration and bleeding; co‑prescribe a proton‑pump inhibitor (e.g., omeprazole 20 mg daily). Use the lowest effective dose for the shortest duration. (NICE CG177 Osteoarthritis, 2023)
Assess renal, cardiovascular and hepatic risk before initiating NSAID therapy in older adults. (BNF NSAIDs, accessed 20 Jun 2025)
